content: We just merged #25252, which makes it possible to sort Recent topics by unread count. It's been deployed to CZO, and feedback is appreciated!

The really wide hover area on the left looks odd to me. @Aman (amanagr) did you say this is difficult to change, though?

Screen-Shot-2023-09-13-at-3.35.17-PM.png
That looks good to me at least!

This popped up on the rust-lang instance:

One of the column headers on the “Recent conversations” page shows an unread messages notification (dot superimposed on envelope), even when there are no unread messages.

There doesn't seem to be any way to dismiss or hide this notification.

To which another user replied:

my perhaps incorrect understanding is that the envelope with a dot means "sort by unread messages" though I'm not sure about the direction of this sorting

So there are at least three potential issues here:

  • The dot on the icon is being perceived by some users as indicating a notification (it's not)
  • The column itself probably deserves a tooltip, since there is no text equivalent
  • The tooltip might also help clarify the sort-order confusion, too
I had thought we had a tooltip in that column; agree we should add one. @Aman (amanagr) FYI.
3 messages were moved here from #issues > notification-sort icon confusion by Tim Abbott.
Yeah... "Sort by unread message count" for the tooltip?
That's a bit of a mouthful, but I don't know how well something like "Sort by unreads" would translate (or be understood...)
Yeah I think "Sort by unread message count" is fine -- you're not going to be seeing that tooltip unless you've hovered over it.
